column4: hey, i know the package network-manager-gnome fixes the ipw3945 to make it work
but on my lspci it still comes up as a unknown device is that cool?
so how bad could edgy be
well yes im going to upgrade to full when it comes
The issue is when beta testers expect the same level of support as the release.

While devs expect (quite rightly), that beta (and developmental) releases are not intended for "newbies" that expect everything to "just work" - it may well, but those users should not expect teh same level of suppot.
i don't consider myself a newbie, but im not the greatest. like i did my own lfs install, gentoo install and everything worked without anyones help
Then you are not a newbie. :)

Debian users has a particularly hard time with this, with so many clueless newbies trying to use debian unstable, just because it's got the latest and greatest, and then claiming that it's stable and always works well for them - when it's /not/ stable, heck, named "Sid" after the kid next door who breaks toys.
